definitions: To manage and supervise the execution, application, or conduct of something.
To give or apply (drugs, medicine, or a sacrament).
To provide or apply (a remedy or a dose of something).
To manage the affairs of (a business, organization, or public office).
To give or mete out (justice, punishment, or a blow).
examples: The estate was administered by her brother.
The priest administered the last rites.
